forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 60. Southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 67. Southwest wind 9 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

weather_report:
As the night drapes its quiet blanket over Downtown San Francisco, a mere whisper of cloud cover lingers in the skies. The temperatures are comfortably mild, hovering around the low sixties, inviting a relaxed start to the day despite the looming fog that gently hugs the coastline. The breeze carries a soft, invigorating chill from the southwest, stirring up an energy that promises both motivation and peace.

Come daylight, the city will awaken to a partly sunny tableau, with temperatures progressing to a pleasant sixty-seven. It will be one of those days when the city is free, for the most part, from the dense maritime layer that usually adds a bit of mystery to the landscape. Layers are your friend today—perhaps a light jacket or a cozy cardigan perfect for the cooler morning, transitioning into something lighter as the sun rises higher and warms the pavement. Consider a stroll down to one of the many cafes dotting the streets; a warm cup of coffee in hand while you bask in the gentle sunshine and appreciate the familiar hum of the city at work. As the day unfolds, it’s an ideal time to explore lesser-known pockets, perhaps the nooks and crannies of the Mission District, where street art and culinary delights coalesce effortlessly, or to wander along the Embarcadero, with its enchanting views of the bay sparkling like diamonds. 

In this city that knows how to embrace the fog as gracefully as it embraces the sun, today beckons for adventures that intersect with comfort, conversation, and a dash of spontaneity.
